dialogues.Lisa:
[1]		Why?  Well, uh, it's kind of like 		askin', "Why do all the guys chew 		Copenhagen?"  You know?  I mean, if 		you're seventeen and you're not a 		total fry, it's just what you do.  	ETHEL MERMAN's "Everything's Coming Up Roses" PLAYS over 	speakers.  
[2] 
[3]		I'm gonna sing and dance to, "New 		York, New York."  See, I fell in love 		with The Big Apple last summer when I 		was visitin' my brother.  He followed 		his dream to New York.  	PICKS UP 8x10's, shows to camera.  
[4]		This is Peter as Liza.  This is him as 		Madonna.  Oh, here's me with him as 		Barbara...  
[5]		Ow!  Oh, God.  It's so em-so 		embarrassing.  
[6]		You guys know the retard's pants are 		open? 			 		I don't want to see that.  
[7] 
[8]		Oh-yah, I love to swim.  When I was in 		New York, I met Greg Louganis at one-a 		my brothers' shows...  
[9] 	wearing a Statue of Liberty Headdress.  (It's a Barbie 	Doll that holds an unlit birthday candle.  
[10]		Living in a country where Lady Liberty 		keeps her flame burning bright.  	She reaches up with a lighter to light the candle. It's 	hard to reach and won't light.  
[11]		Keeps her flame burning bright...  
[12]		Hey, my hands are stuck.  
[13]		Listen, you guys, don't go int the 		bathroom.  Tess blew chunks all over. 		Man, she ate a big dinner.  
[14]			 		Oh, Amber...  
[15]		I can't believe this is happenin'.  I 		can't believe she said you couldn't...  	Getting an idea, Lisa starts to take off her jacket.  
[16]		Amber?  Here.  
[17]		My jacket.  Take it kcause, y'know, I 		got my costume okay'd before the 		pageant.  You can wear it.  
[18]		Shut up, yous guys.  Look, Amber, I'm 		not gonna win.  And let's be honest, a 		family only needs one "Liza" and you 		know Peter's got much better legs than 		me.  
[19]		Oh c'mon, I love kem, but you know 		they only had me kcause Peter needed a 		kidney.  
[20]		Then do it for Peter.  Mrs. Leeman 		used to call him a "skinny little fag" 		when he'd bag her groceries.  He'd pop 		his Nancy-belt if his old jacket 		somehow, I don't know, got her back.  
[21]		Oh-you-beccha.  	Amber hugs her and takes the jacket.  
[22]		I quit.  And, uh, since my costume, 		y'know, was okay'd a month ago?  I'm 		givin' it to Amber.  	Amber breaks a smile.  	Taped music ENDS.  APPLAUSE.  Gladys, mic in hand, joins 	Becky for a big hug.  
[23]		No, it was worth it.  Amber shoulda 		won.  
[24]		I'll tell ya one thing.  Peter never 		woulda pulled a shenanigan like that.  
[25]		Well, y'know what, dad?  Y'know what? 		Peter's gay!  	She runs off.  Her parents stop DEAD IN THEIR TRACKS.  
[26]		What?!

dialogues.Lester:
[1]		...You betcha.  S'posed to be colder-n- 		a witches tit tonight...  
[2]			 		Hey, ya like it?  Open it...Yah-the 		globe.  Pull at the equator there.  
[3]		Fits three full-size booze bottles. 		The cassette deck pulls outta 		Afghanistan, there.  
[4]		Oh, all right 			 		How soon they forget where all this 		comes from.  
[5]		That's enough, young lady.  
[6]		Yah-she's damn near as good as that 		little black fella - with the glass 		eye.  
[7]		Yeah, yeah, the Jew.  
[8]		Hey Tim, Carla - if yous kids don't 		try to Jew me down none, I'll throw in 		a matchin' hutch.  	The COUPLE smiles excitedly.  
[9]			 		See, that there's my specialty.  Don't 		pay me less and I'll give ya more. 			 		Secret is, the hutch is included in 		the price.  Ain't that right, Jean?  	Lester smacks Jean on the ass.  
[10]		Take a memo, sweetheart.  
[11]		Ahhh.  Beautiful as a whore's ass 		today.  Eh, boys?  	In the b.g., Gladys holds a bullhorn, clipboard and 	points to a LARGE SWAN FLOAT.  
[12]		Yah-Gladys had me order that swan 		special made from Mexico 		in case Becky won.  I do a lotta 		business with those people.  I always 		offer to pay kem in tacos. 			 		Whoo, they love that.  
[13]		Gladys!  Stop it!  
[14]		So help me, Gladys.  
[15]		That's enough!
dialogues.Leeman:
[1]		Good God, Iris, you taped your shows 		over it.  
[2]		Now ladies, the rest of the tape - 		which is now gone forever - goes on 		about startin' this great American 		journey we call American Teen 		Princess...Yah-so, any of you young 		ladies who'd like to start on that 		journey, you just come right down here 		and sign up.  And please...help 		yourselves to some coffee and bars...  
[3]
[4] 	Civil Servettes and crew are piled in.  Gladys drives.  
[5]		 		I'll always remember what she wrote in 		the card.  "Jesus loves winners." 		That's why, no matter what I do...  	She shoves the magazine back in her pistol.  
[6] 	Landscaped grounds surround this lovely two-story.  
[7] 	Brief "LIFESTYLES OF THE RICH & FAMOUS" montage of Gladys 	showing off interiors to the theme from "GONE WITH THE 
[8] 	It looks like a Levitz showroom.  Gladys sits stiffly 	between Becky and her husband, LESTER - mid-60's, gruff, 	"old school" salesman, drink in hand.  
[9] 
[10] 	Lester's gone from the couch.  
[11] 	Follow Lester around cheesy room displays.  JEAN KANGAS, 	his meek, middle-aged secretary follows him everywhere. 	Lester CALLS OUT to a YOUNG COUPLE sitting in a dining 	room.

dialogues.Amber:
[1]			 		Hi, I-I'm Amber Atkins and, um, I'm 		signin' up k'cause, ah, my two 		favorite people in the world competed. 		My mom and Diane Sawyer...Course I 		hope I end up a little more like Diane 		Sawyer than my mom...  	She flashes a GRIN, we melt.  
[2] 
[3]			 		Oh, my God, no.  Oh, God.  I just do 		the hair and makeup on the deceased.  
[4]		I'm lucky I have an after-school job 		where I can practice my talent.  
[5]			 		Well...it's the least I can do for the 		reigning Mount Rose Junior Miss Amer--  	Amber pulls the brush away with a clump of Mary's hair 	dangling from it.  
[6]		Oh God...  
[7]		Huh?  Oh...Uh, just a little snarl...  	Amber mouths, "Shhh!  Don't tell!" to camera as she tries 	to pull the clump of hair from the brush.  
[8]		There we go.  	She holds the mirror for Mary.  
[9]		Yah... sure...  	Amber gives a kind but worried smile to camera. 	Suddenly, Becky Leeman enters with a large box of 	chocolates.  She's fully aware of the cameras from the 	moment she enters.  
[10]		What're you doin' here?  
[11]		How nice, Becky, she's anorexic.  	Becky roughly puts her hands over Mary's ears, who's now 	gently petting the spilled chocolates in her lap.  
[12] 	Amber stands in a room the SIZE OF A CLOSET.  Posters, 	articles and pictures of great tap dancers and Diane 	Sawyer cover the walls.  
[13]		... Dreams?  Yah-sure I got kem... 		Sometimes I dream of winnin'... I 		dream of gettin' outta Mount Rose and 		bein' a big time reporter like Diane 		Sawyer.  I mean, guys get outta Mount 		Rose all the time for hockey 		scholarships or prison.  But the 		pageant's kinda my only chance.  		 
[14] 	Amber points to LARGE PAGEANT PHOTO OF DIANE SAWYER - 	1963  
[15]		... Yah-1963.  Her beauty worked 		against her when she started as a 		reporter in Louisville, her hometown. 		Those were different times.  
[16]			 		That's my mom. 			 		I'll get kem in a sec.  	ANNETTE ATKINS, Amber's mom - sexy, but tired - OPENS THE

[18]		Hi.  	Becky notices their attraction and goes from flirt to 	uber-bitch in a heartbeat.  
[19]		Here, I'll take it.  It's my job.  
[20]		Well, you're supposed to put it in 		the...  	Becky THROWS her tray on the counter spraying Amber with 	food as she storms off.

[22]		I know.  
[23]		 
[24]		Huntin' season.  	Shocked at the coincidence, they share a laugh.  
[25]		Yah-sure, fine...fine.  
[26]		Bye.  	Amber smiles, gives a shy little wave - then, to camera.  
[27]		Oh, God - you don't think Becky saw 		you guys, do you? 			 		Look, you just shouldn't be in here...  
[28]		No, listen. 			 		We shouldn't talk here.  Stop by my 		house tonight, okay?  	She looks around and motions them to rush off.  
[29]			 		Ahhh!  Je-sus-Christ-on-a-cross! 			 		Look, number one rule in a funeral 		home - never sneak up on the livin'. 		You never know who could have an 		embalming needle or skull saw in their 		hand.  Mr. Larson's son learned that 		the hard way - he's buried next to my 		Grandpa!  	Amber turns to the slab to continue working.  She pulls 	off the SHEET to reveal BRETT, handsome football player, 	still wearing his hunting plaid.  
[30]			 		Upset about Brett?  Nah.  Hazard of 		the trade.  I don't really have time 		for guys anyways.  It's weird, though. 		He took it right between the eyes. 		Don't often see that.  
[31]		Sorry.  I just thought she might not 		wanna meet her Maker lookin' like a 		cheap whore.  
[32]			 		-- red nose and ears.  I know, I know.  	Mr. Larson PULLS Stella's coffin out.  
[33]		Sorry I couldn't talk today 		kcause...I'm scared, okay? 			 		I open my locker right after first 		period and there's a picture of Tammy 		Curry taped inside.  
[34]		This was written on back.  	She turns the picture over to reveal, "YOU'RE NEXT!"  
[35]		Yah-sure, Tammy liked to driver her 		dad's thresher - she said the heavy 		vibration helped her think, y'know? 		But I know for a fact she only smoked 		after a good drive.  You ask me or 		anyone else who isn't scared to talk 		about it - Tammy was murdered. 			 		God, I bet Diane Sawyer never had to 		deal with crap like this... 			 		Toss me "Caucasian #5," would ya?  	A crew guy walks IN FRAME and hands her a make-up jar.

[37]		No, don't say it.  Another stray 		bullet to the head.  	She adjusts Brett's red plaid hunting cap.  
[38]		I'm gonna need more caps.  
[39]		Relax, that's my ma's code for, "Bring 		home milk and a carton-a Luckys."  
[40]		Oh my God - no!  Is my mom okay?  Was 		she home?  	Hearse SCREECHES to a halt.  We hear a THUD, then MOANS 	from in back.  Amber jumps out.  Camera follows, a la 	"COPS."  It's pandemonium with fire trucks, neighbors, an 	ambulance, etc.  
[41]		Mom!  Mom!?  MOMMMM!  	Loretta runs up to Amber as TWO FIREMEN approach.  
[42]			 		Is Mom okay?  
[43]		Where is she?!  
[44]		Mommmm!  I'll be right behind you in 		the hearse!  
[45]		Oh, Mom, it's so ugly.

[48]		Oh God, I'm dead...  	A candy striper approaches them.

[57]		That's it, I'm goin'...  
[58]		God I hope that's you and not your 		concussion talkin'.  
[59]		I love you much.  	Annette hugs Amber.  
[60]		No.  Mom said if I did, she'd look up 		my dad and marry him.

[62]		Oh-yah.

It 		was still on the hanger.

[71]		My mom wanted me to have this?  
[72]		Loretta, never have kids.

[74] 	with a MAP OF THE U.S. HEADDRESS, dances up to the mic.  
[75]		Living in a country where no matter 		who you are or where you come from, 		you can grow up and become what you've 		always dreamed of, makes me, Amber 		Atkins, proud to be an American!  
[76]		Oh my God!  My-my tap costume's gone.  	Commotion stops.  Becky continues to get ready.  
[77]		No, wait.  It-it was here before the 		openin' number...wait.  What am I 		sayin'?  I should just ask you, Becky. 		Where is it?  	Becky freezes, staring daggers at Amber.  
[78]		You heard me.  Where is it?  	The other contestants slowly clear a path between them.  
[79]		I just did.  
[80]		Oh-oh, you bring me some of that 		snotty attitude, Becky - bring it on.  
[81]		Oh, I'll "get it."  I'll "get it" all 		right.  I might even take seconds.  	They're moving ever closer...

Becky doesn't have a chance.  She's a pink taffeta BALL 	OF FIRE.  The swan's back eventually collapses taking 	Becky into it's burning belly.

[17]		Okay, okay!  Listen-up.  Coupla notes 		from last night's dress rehearsal. 			 		Number one, Gladys says a coupla yous 		are gettin' sexy with your hips durin' 		the "Physical Fitness" routine...

[24]			 		"I'd like to take you back seventeen 		years, when a peanut farmer was in the 		White House, a group-a boys callin' 		themselves kQueen' topped the record 		charts and Gladys Leeman was Gladys 		Wood and she was Mount Rose American 		Teen Princess!" dialogues.Loretta:
[1]		What do you mean, they take out her 		butt?

[3]		Hi.  
[4]		Oh, naw.  Hi.

[8]		Oh, Christ, it's true.  	Annette begins to comb out Loretta's hair.  
[9]			 		Let's just say who should win, who 		deserves to win is Amber.  
[10]		She's the prettiest, y'know.  The best 		damn tapper.  The most smartest...

[18]		She's alive, sweetie.

[20]		Don't let that worry you, Annette!  
[21]			 		Annette, why don't you just see if 		there's any beer left in that can and 		relax a bit.  
[22]		You're what?!  
[23]		I heard you, I was just tryin' to 		scare you into changin' your mind.  Oh 		for Chrissakes, Amber, the woman clung 		to your tap shoes while flyin' through 		the air like a Goddamn lawn dart!  
[24]			 		D'ya think a nice cool mint'd help if 		I shoved your head up your ass?  	Fear sweeps over the Candy Striper - she bolts down the 	hall!  Loretta puts an arm around Amber and starts to 	walk down the opposite direction.  
[25]		Simple.  Just say, "Mom, I know you 		sacrificed everything - relationships, 		dreams - your tummy, ass and thighs - 		all to bring me into this world.
